relation: See Cache_Lite constructor for more options
default cache group for function caching
Don't cache the method call when its output contains the string "NOCACHE". If set to true, the output of the method will never be displayed (because the output is used to control the cache)
Don't cache the method call when its result is false
Don't cache the method call when its result is null
textBeforeTable: associative array to set a lot of options (see Cache_Lite constructor for details). Be careful, with Cache_Lite_Function, additional options are available (comparatively to Cache_Lite). There are described on the following table. $options array Parameter The constructor of the Cache_Lite_Output class. You can give an associative array as an argument to set a lot of options. Description void constructor Cache_Lite_Function::Cache_Lite_Function ( array $options = array(NULL) ) require_once 'Cache/Lite/Function.php'; Synopsis Cache_Lite_Function::Cache_Lite_Function() – Constructor constructor constructor Cache_Lite_Function::Cache_Lite_Function API Documentation Package Info get Constructor drop call Constructor end start Constructor extendLife raiseError lastModified getMemoryCachingState saveMemoryCachingState setLifeTime setToDebug clean remove save get Constructor Introduction Cache_Lite PEAR Manual
textAfterTable: Note This function can not be called statically.
